page.title: 03Dramatics in Ribchester
page.content: The RATS stands for Ribchester Amateur Theatrical Society. RATS started in 1971 by the then rector Mr Cornish.The RATS first production was "Music hall". The second a musical called "The Boyfriend".RATS do about 3 or 4 plays a year one of which is always a pantomime.This year it will be the first time RATS have ever repeated a pantomime-"Aladdin".The ages of the performers range from 11 to over 70.RATS raise money for charity by doing old time music Halls,barn dances and westerns,etc. Different members produce plays as well. There is a lot of work that goes on behind the scenes such as makeup artists, costumes, hairstyles, refreshments,scenery, music,ticket selling, publicity and prompting. Several original members are still in the RATS.
